html:
Alternative forms[edit]

  • conpellō

Pronunciation[edit]

  • (Classical) IPA(key): /komˈpel.loː/, [kɔmˈpɛl.lʲoː]
  • (Ecclesiastical) IPA(key): /komˈpel.lo/, [kɔmˈpɛl.lɔ]

Etymology 1[edit]

From con- (“together”) +‎ pellō (“drive”).

Verb[edit]

compellō (present infinitive compellere, perfect active compulī, supine compulsum); third conjugation

  1. I compel
  2. I urge
  3. I drive together
Conjugation[edit]

Descendants[edit]
  • Catalan: compel·lir
  • English: compel
  • Middle French: compellir
  • Portuguese: compelir
  • Spanish: compeler

Etymology 2[edit]

From con- (“together”) +‎ pellō (“drive”) +‎ -ō.

Verb[edit]

compellō (present infinitive compellāre, perfect active compellāvī, supine compellātum); first conjugation

  1. I address, accost
  2. I challenge
  3. I rebuke
  4. I accuse
  5. I compel, incite, impel, drive, force
